thread.title: Michael Flynn Departure Reveals Lack of Order in Trump White House
thread.title_full: Michael Flynn Departure Reveals Lack of Order in Trump White House

author: Kenneth T. Walsh
title: Michael Flynn Departure Reveals Lack of Order in Trump White House

organizations.name: trump white house cancel then-defense intelligence agency

text:
Cancel Then-Defense Intelligence Agency Director Lt. Gen. Michael Flynn testifies on Capitol Hill in Washington. Flynn resigned as President Donald Trump's national security adviser on Feb. 13, 2017.   
Donald Trump has suffered an embarrassing setback to his fledgling presidency with the resignation of White House National Security Adviser Michael Flynn after less than a month on the job. 
In the end, it became a matter of trust. Flynn, a retired general, apparently misled Vice President Mike Pence about whether he talked to Russian officials about U.S. sanctions imposed on Russia prior to Trump's inauguration. This raised questions about whether Flynn could be trusted in the future, White House sources told various media outlets. RELATED CONTENT
